summary: study aimed to determine the most common bacterial agents causing UTI in different seasons among patients admitted to the inpatient department at BCH, Saudi Arabia. most bacterial strains were gram-negative. it is one of the most frequently occurring infections reported in both inpatients and outpatients. it may not occur if bacteria are introduced into the bladder due to body’s immune defense that helps protect the urinary tract. resistance to an antibiotic may be acquired by a bacterium by horizontal gene transfer mechanism. this resistance may also apply simultaneously to
